titleStmt.title: Hugh W. Tener to Thomas B. Monroe, Jr.
CWG2508

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Law and Collection Office
OF
TENER & DAVIS,
No 13 South Third Street,
Philadelphia April 16 1861
Copy --
Dear Sir:

Your favor of 12th inst is received. For which please accept my thanks -- I was just on the point of writing for a renewal of my commission -- Enclosed find Five Dollars, on receipt of which, I will be obliged if you will send me a new commission as comr of Ky

T. B. Monroe Jr Esq
Sec'y of State
Frankfort Ky

Pennysylvania
Comr. of Deeds
H. W. Tener
Philad.

T. B. Monroe Jr. Esq.
Secy. of State
Frankfort Ky.
Dear Sir:
I have been looking from for an answer to the within for several days past.
A reply by return mail will much oblige

Yours, respy.
Hugh W. Tener
K. J. Tener
